I'll try and come back for this in 2017. I definitely disappeared around April due both to workload increases, as well as a bit too much drama I/R/T author choices. Here's to hoping for a more positive 2017 and maybe a bit more intriguing reading, now that a lot of the standards were used up in 2016.
Right? I'm sitting here like, "Is it the worst if I laughed so hard while I watched it I was nearly crying?"

That's actually a decent pick. It seemed like all year the UFC was trying to use him as a stepping stone for other fighters, and every time he rose to the challenge and really put on some excellent shows.

I can't pick between Bisping and Miocic, they've both had incredible years, but I think the edge goes slightly to Bisping because of the absolute fairy-tale like nature of what he's achieved this year.
I used to do this with gel roller pens when I was bored in high school. Not to this level, of course, but I'd forgotten about that until just now. Thanks for that trip down memory lane, op.

She wasn't. Read the article, happened on a Friday.

Hello, everyone!
I started studying Japanese in high school, which at this point I'm afraid to admit was 14 years ago. I never gained fluency out of school, though I had continued my studies a few years into college. After I had graduated, my husband had started to study the language while he was in undergrad, and I began to realize that I was forgetting how to say certain things. I decided that I was GOING to be fluent one day.
Fast forward 5 years and here I am...still uh...not fluent. But far better off. Every year I kickstart my studies into gear again and do really well for the first few months of the year until things trail off. I'm ready for a new motivation and something to keep me going long into 2017.
I do also plan on getting a tutor this year, as I am finally in a life situation where I think I can probably swing the cost, so if I'm financially investing in this pursuit, I'm hoping that's all the more motivation for me.
Thank you all, I'm really excited to see where 2017 takes us all, good luck!

I don't like labels so, I don't know what you would correctly refer to me as, a progressive person of faith? Regardless, my point is, I'm not an evangelical, but I do consider myself Christian.
Anyways, watching what Bill Nye has turned into has really bummed me out in a way it shouldn't. Loved the guy as a kid, he taught me so much, but the way he talks now just seems so... Hateful. I don't know...

The blue/black that they've been sporting already is actually my favorite Reebok Kit I've seen. If I were a fan of any of those fighters beyond a cursory level, I'd be tempted to buy one. I especially love Overeem's hat.
That was an FS1 card.

If she is unwell, though, I don't think she's being unfair in saying, why can't this wait until I'm well. I see your point , though, I do. I don't disagree, I'm just not 100% sold that she's making up excuses, and isn't legitimate that she needs time to recover.

I/R/T your edit: The comments in this thread are kinda insane to me. It really doesn't seem like anyone read what she said at all. She never refused to fight. She gave legitimate reasons for why she needs time off. Of course, there's always going to be a "the truth is in the middle" aspect to these stories, but regardless, she does at least seem to have a decent reason for wanting time off, and more notice before her next fight. IMO.
I actually literally rolled with laughter, just a little bit.
I was RIGHT there with you, Carla, until you wrote "drops the mic" without even some asterisks or something.
I'm glad to hear it was just one voice at least.

I must not have very many intense swj people on my Facebook, because I didn't hear a word of complaint about the holiday, yet the second I got home, my step-dad ranted Non-stop all week about it. He watches fox news ad nauseum, and I was wondering if this was another non-issue that Fox was pumping up to show those overly sensitive libruls want to steal our culture things again.
Sad to see there really are people trying to decry a genuinely great day of thanks and celebration.
Thank you very much!
Ah, that explains it, thanks!

That's kinda what I'm hoping, since I'd really like to read it. My husband picked it up after I watched the film for the first time, about 3 years ago, and then we watched the movie together once he'd finished it.
He was of a similar mind to you, I believe, in that he was like, well, this movie LOOKS great, but it's NOT Less Than Zero.

I'm glad I haven't read the book, simply because I can continue to love the movie. I just know if I read the book, I'll never be able to look at it the same way. But, as you say, the cinematography of that movie is pretty fantastic.
The scene out by the pool at night is one of my favorite scenes to watch of all time.
This one: https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-5cN5B4M54Fw/V0hxCiDc33I/AAAAAAAAIFM/G0WuDmhKtEcH7WccSVBIhLCOBz9NdEwRQCLcB/s1600/tumblr_mquab8Wfho1r37tnpo2_r1_500.png I think it's during the Christmas part, or something along those lines.

Haha, haven't seen the movie! I'll check it out. ~~I've randomly only seen the sequel.~~ Apparently I am thinking of a completely different movie, because I've definitely never seen the sequel to this.
Excellent, thank you!

YES! Oh I forgot about that one. See, one of the reasons I wanted to start a discussion about this. I want a reference list of scenes to go to, so I can kinda build up a better visual idea for what I'd like to do someday, should I ever stop being lazy and actually film something in the future.
This scene has it all, though. Smoke, Music, Great action, and similar to what I like so much about the scene in Fright Night, it just leaves you really antsy on the edge of your seat because there's so much suspense built up over the course of the scene.

The scene from Fright Night, which is probably my favorite, period:

WRITING.TITLE: I've come to realize I really enjoy 80s movie club scenes.
WRITING.TEXT:
So, just a random thought, but over the last few years, I've come to notice that I really enjoy those (mostly useless) club scenes that seem to have a tendency to pop up in 80s movies.
Some of the scenes that come to mind, for me, first are Fright Night, Brain Damage, the boardwalk stuff from Lost Boys and Tuff Turf. Huh, that's actually a lot of horror movies, I just realized.
Anyways, the music and the cinematography of those scenes just really grabs me. Does anyone else share a love for these types of scenes, and what are your favorites, if so?
One of the most satisfying things I've ever watched.
Never heard this reference, now I've seen it twice in two Reddit threads back to back. Weird.

If you didn't pick up the company's name, the ad didn't really work.

Could it be Stipe? It's been a minute.

I was looking for this and Rookie of the Year references and I got both. Thank you, Reddit.

I just want to tell you all, from the bottom of my heart, thank you for the laughs this and last week.
On Friday, especially, I was feeling particularly down. That was the day where I let myself think I wasn't feeling so depressed anymore, and then one little thing happened and I found myself right back on the ledge.
I so happened to log in here, saw one little post that made me smile despite how bad I felt, so I clicked another and another, and soon I was really laughing. Throughout the rest of the day, when I started feeling a little gloomy again, I just came over here to see that there were people I could commiserate with, who were also still laughing and trying to find the humor in the situation.
Thank you for getting me off the ledge on Friday. It meant everything in those moments to smile.

Although I found a lower quality version of it on Youtube:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kqppbDej9Cg

That laugh at the end, though, finally got me to look up whether he's ever narrated an audio book.
He has :|. A Dean Koontz book. I've never wanted to read his stuff, but to hear Spader read for hours? Tempting....
Yeah, that doesn't surprise me, just the first time seeing it has surprised me.
Oh God , went back and looked. Can't stop laughing.
I'm going to have nightmares about that.

This is the only show I've ever watched where the creators are being so active on Twitter. Honestly, I hate it and find it pathetic. Either trust your writing, or do something else. They're undermining the integrity of the show by adding more information directly to the audience.
That's a hard pill to swallow when you consider the 'it's Elizabeth' line to Dembe, though.
Seemed like they remembered her similarly if anything.
They had to let us know, though, to avoid turning off any more viewers. This was the best way of handling it.
If they add in a third party, I don't care how much I love Spader, I'll officially be out. One can only handle so much bad writing.
The John's saying things on twitter like he's not her father.
He's the dad. The writers of this show wanted a big plot twist, but they weren't great with subtlety, so they ruined it very early on. To counter, the whole Twitter thing happened, IMO.
But that's Red, isn't it? Or are we going with the metaphorical one?
Laughed really hard. I had actually only seen a still image of this before now. Somehow missed there was an entire video of ptsd dog.
Smarf is the father.

Whoever it is, I'm guessing there's some kind of moral duplicity at play allowing them to get away with it. Theres no scenario, with this cast at this point, that makes any of them being a mole make sense.
I don't remember. What episode was it?
Sam, Kirk, Red... Who is 4?
Hahaha, Jesus... This show. Didn't even think of that.

I just don't trust the John's though. They're notorious liars.
I hadn't heard the Red is Katerina theory before today, and Dammit I hate how believable it is.

They answered the question in the episode when Red killed Sam. Twice. First to Sam with the, 'you will always be her father speech,' and a second time to Tom right afterwards with the, 'her father will always be there.' speech.
The Internet kept this silly crusade going, not the writers.

If tonight wasn't enough for you to understand Red's logic on this topic, I don't know what is.
Are you her father? It doesn't matter. Are you her father? You raised her as your own you are her father. Are you her father? Sam is her father.
Are you her father? Yes.
So look, he's her biological father, but he doesn't feel that he has any claim to call her his own. He refers to the death of her father the night of the fire, but in ALL likelihood at this point, he's talking about a metaphorical death to the person he was, and he feels he is someone else now, and not someone who can claim her as his daughter.
In his eyes he didn't lie to her. He manipulated the truth to protect her.
We're up to three now, right?
Yay!

I did have one. I'm embarrassed to think of how dark my thoughts were for a little while there. I'm feeling better now. Now I'm just sad because I thought mandated maternity leave was about to be a reality, but now I'm worrying about even having insurance.

I have no idea what his character's name is, but my favorite recurring - character - who - never - speaks is the guy I refer to as The Dude. He's like the leader of Red's team? And kinda looks like Jeff Bridges if you squint. Something about him showing up week after week, kicking ass, but saying nothing cracks me up. That actor has the most developed extra role ever.

This far along there's no chance they don't finish a 4th season to get to syndication. A fifth is iffy, but I suspect they'll do it to finish off the story. This was always a very obvious five and done to me.

From NWI, moved to LA a few years ago. Flew out to Chicago for the weekend just to stand outside the stadium on the off chance I'd get to sing Go Cubs Go with the crowd.

It was 100% worth it. Wasn't the first time I'd sung the song, but certainly the most significant for me.
